               SCSerializer serializer,

Parameters:
manager - the Manager to use
serializer - the serializer to use or null for the default serializer
memoryCache - the memory cache to use or null for the default memory cache
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Close the cache. It will no longer be available after this method has been called

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if there was a problem closing internal threads

setNotificationHandler

public void setNotificationHandler(SCNotifications handler)
Set a handler to be called at interesting events

Parameters:
handler - new handler or null to clear

getNotificationHandler

public SCNotifications getNotificationHandler()
Return the currently set notification handler

Returns:
handler or null

put

public void put(SCDataBlock block)
Put the object specified by the given data block into the cache

Parameters:
block - data. At minimum, SCDataBlock.key(String), SCDataBlock.ttl(long) and SCDataBlock.object(Object) must be set. Ownership of the block is taken by this method.

putWithBackup

public void putWithBackup(SCDataBlock block)
Only available if the SCMultiManager is being used

Same as put(SCDataBlock) - however, the data is written to 2 managed servers for safety. i.e. if the main server fails, the data is still available on the backup.

Parameters:
block - data. At minimum, SCDataBlock.key(String), SCDataBlock.ttl(long) and SCDataBlock.object(Object) must be set. Ownership of the block is taken by this method.

get

public java.lang.Object get(SCDataBlock block)
Try to retrieve an object from the cache

Parameters:
block - data. At minimum, SCDataBlock.key(String) must be set. You can also set SCDataBlock.versionNumber(int), if the object's version in the cache doesn't match, it will be considered missing. You can also set the versionNumber to the special value SCDataBlock.DONT_CARE_VERSION_NUMBER and the versionNumber will be ignored.
Returns:
the object or null

get

public java.lang.Object get(SCDataBlock block,
                            java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<SCCache.GetTypes> getType)
Try to retrieve an object from the cache

Parameters:
block - data. At minimum, SCDataBlock.key(String) must be set. You can also set SCDataBlock.versionNumber(int), if the object's version in the cache doesn't match, it will be considered missing. You can also set the versionNumber to the special value SCDataBlock.DONT_CARE_VERSION_NUMBER and the versionNumber will be ignored.
getType - if not null, returns a status value
Returns:
the object or null

removeGroup

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> removeGroup(SCGroup group)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
sccache supports associative keys via SCGroup. This method deletes all objects associated with the given group.

Parameters:
group - the group to delete
Returns:
list of keys deleted.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - errors

listGroup

                                           throws java.lang.Exception
sccache supports associative keys via SCGroup. This method returns all object keys associated with the given group.

Parameters:
group - the group to list
Returns:
